009package imagingbook.common.ransac;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012//import java.util.HashSet;
013import java.util.Random;
014
015/**
016 * Randomly draws a set of k unique, non-null elements from a given array
017 * with elements of type T, which may contain null elements.
018 * The size of the draw (k) is fixed and must be specified at construction.
019 * The resulting sets contain no duplicate elements.
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 *
023 * @param <T> element type
024 */
025public class RandomDraw<T> {
026        
027        private static final int MaxTries = 1000;       // worst case number of tries before exception is thrown
028        private final Random rand;
029        
030        // -------------------------------------------------------------
031        
032        public RandomDraw(Random rand) {
033                this.rand = (rand == null) ? new Random() : rand;
034        }
035        
036        public RandomDraw() {
037                this(new Random());
038        }
039        
040        // -------------------------------------------------------------
041        
042        // version using a HashSet (slower)
043//      public T[] drawFrom(T[] items, int k) {
044//              if (k < 1) throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater or equal 1");
045//               HashSet<T> hs = new HashSet<>(k);
046//              int i = 0;
047//              while (i < k) { // TODO: avoid infinite loop!
048//                      int j = rand.nextInt(items.length);     // next random index
049//                      T item = items[j];
050//                      if (item != null && hs.add(item)) {
051//                              i++;
052//                      }
053//              }
054//              return hs.toArray(Arrays.copyOf(items, k));
055//      }
056        
057        
058        public T[] drawFrom(T[] items, int k) {
059                if (k < 1) throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater or equal 1");
060                int[] idx = drawRandomIndexes(items, k);
061                T[] draw = Arrays.copyOf(items, k);     // trick to create an array of generic type T
062                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
063                        draw[i] = items[idx[i]];
064                }
065                return draw;
066        }
067        
068        // draw k unique integers (all must be different):
069        private int[] drawRandomIndexes(T[] items, int k) {
070                int[] indexes = new int[k];
071                for (int d = 0; d < k; d++) {
072                        int j = 0;                                                      // count tries
073                        int i = rand.nextInt(items.length);
074                        while (items[i] == null || wasPickedBefore(indexes, d, i)) {
075                                i = rand.nextInt(items.length);
076                                if (j++ > MaxTries) {
077                                        throw new RuntimeException("max. tries exceeded: " + j);
078                                }
079                        }
080                        indexes[d] = i;
081                }
082                return indexes;
083        }
084
085        // Checks if idx[0],...,idx[d-1] contains i.
086        private boolean wasPickedBefore(int[] indexes, int d, int i) {
087                for (int j = 0; j < d; j++) {
088                        if (i == indexes[j]) {
089                                return true;
090                        }
091                }       
092                return false;
093        }
094        
095        /**
096         * Checks for duplicate ("==") elements in the result (simple, for testing only).
097         * @param <Q> the generic element type
098         * @param items array of objects
099         * @return true if any object is null or contained more than once
100         */
101        protected static <Q> boolean hasDuplicates(Q[] items) {
102                for (int i = 0; i < items.length; i++) {
103                        Q x = items[i];
104                        if (x == null)
105                                return true;
106                        for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
107                                if (x == items[j]) {
108                                        return true;
109                                }
110                        }
111                }
112                return false;
113        }
114        
115        
116        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
117        
118        public static void main(String[] args) {
119                Integer[] numbers = { null, 1, 2, null, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, null, null, null, 8, 9, 10 , null};
120//              Integer[] numbers = { 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8};
121                int N = 1000000;
122                RandomDraw<Integer> rd = new RandomDraw<>();
123                
124//              Object[] x = rd.drawFrom(numbers);
125//              System.out.println("x = " + x.getClass());
126//              for(Object o : x) {
127//                      System.out.println(o.getClass());
128//              }
129                
130                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
131                        Integer[] draw = rd.drawFrom(numbers, 2);
132//                      System.out.println(Arrays.toString(draw));
133                        if (hasDuplicates(draw)) {
134                                throw new RuntimeException("duplicates found in " + Arrays.toString(draw));
135                        }
136                }
137                System.out.println("done " + N);
138        }
139        
140//      public static void main(String[] args) {
141//              Integer[] numbers = { 1, 2, 2};
142//              System.out.println("hasDuplicates " + RandomDraw.hasDuplicates2(numbers));
143//      }
144        
145}
